Text: Hyah!
Raagh!
Your approach is weak! Now―
Agh!
Wha―?!
You both attack from too much of a distance.
Urk...!
When you put it like that...

Beta, you take too long when switching between your
sword and bow.

That trick of instantly closing the gap to catch your
enemy off guard isn't a bad one, but they won't
always let you do it.
You're right.

Epsilon, you depend too much on long-range slashes.
You're not offsetting your magic consumption with
stamina.

No matter how unique your attack, if exhaustion slows
you down, your enemy will still be able to pick up on it.
Ouch. She's finding every weak spot!

Your long-distance sword techniques themselves
aren't useless.

But you should master close combat sword fighting
first.

That's the kind of clever action-based policy that will
lead to greater effectiveness for the Garden's sword
users.
Let me offer you two some proof of concept.
Pr-Proof?
What could that mea―

This is a technique I learned directly from Shadow
and adapted myself for the Garden's swordplay.
Directly from Master Shadow?!
Are we allowed to see this?!

Of course. It's not actually that different from
what you two are already doing.
Ebony Swirl!
What was that?!
She threw her slime sword!

You don't simply project a slash. You impart a spin
to the blade itself so that it flies in a curve that
covers the whole field.

It's a technique that can precisely crush a group of
enemies with a whirlwind of magical power
from above.

If I were to give it a better name, I would call it
Flying Ebony Swirl.

A sword is not simply for swinging. It is a weapon
for thrusting, sweeping, striking, slicing...and
throwing.

And with a slime sword that can easily be recovered
using magic, you can be aggressive in throwing it for
midrange attacks.

Shadow's sword techniques and the slime sword are
true treasures. Which is why it's essential to master
the basics.

You two might have to fight multiple enemies at the
same time in your upcoming mission.

You should always be prepared to use the best way for
surviving a fight. Don't just keep focusing on your usual
specialties.
Yes, ma'am!
Understood!
I taught Beta and Epsilon the Ebony Swirl.
The Ebony Swirl?
Oh, that technique!
Yes, that one.

The technique you used to demonstrate the benefits
of the slime sword.

(Whew, I'm glad she taught them instead! I use it
like once a year, tops... If I remember how to.)

The one you used was a spin focused around yourself.
I taught those two my own take on it.
Oh, really? What is that?

I reconfigured it as a throwing technique, making it
easier to aim and giving it the power to take
out groups.
(Wow, really? That sounds so cool.)

(Sword throws are a really good victory sign. Alpha's
getting the hang of the real expert moves.)
Hm. Fascinating. I believe I would like to see that.

Well, I haven't yet given it a battlefield test.
Could you please wait for me to get more
used to it?

Beta and Epsilon should get a chance to test its
effectiveness during their next mission, so I'd like
to wait for their results.
(She taught those two, huh?)

(And the City States are all full of fun resorts and
tourist spots.)

(That Alpha... She does this kind of girls' club vibe,
just like with the Mist Dragon.)

(Right, here's my chance to just casually get
myself taken along.)

The City States, I see. Awakening the sleeping
memory in that land...
What?
I wonder if the Seven Shadows can handle it alone?
Oh!

(Come on, now, get the hint... Can't you sense how
much I want to go?!)

Indeed, but, we can't let that risk discourage us.
And we can't bother you with such things.
Urk...!
Cid?
Huh?
What?
(Sigh. My loss, huh.)
(Still not sure what a loss means for me, though...)

Oh. Yes, of course. Don't fail, Alpha. And give my
regards to Beta and Epsilon.

Understood. I will let them know. They will surely
bring back information that will benefit the Garden.
Wait for good news, Cid!
